dialogues.text: Low in the inky sky, a FULL MOON burns brilliantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: as Lawrence comes out from Talbot Hall accompanie by Dr. Lloyd. They walk, both carrying RIFLES.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Your father and I have been friends for, well... more years than this old man cares to count. I was there, Lawrence, when you came into this world. And over these past weeks even in the midst of everything... I'm glad to have made your acquaintance.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Likewise, Doctor.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: I believe you've been a great comfort to John. He'd tell you himself, I'm certain... would that he were capable of such sentiment. Doctor Lloyd and Lawrence share a rueful smile.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm sure you're right. They walk on, continuing to...

dialogues.speaker: THE GREAT LAWN
dialogues.text: Where a breeze carries the undulating, thickening FOG. In the light of many LANTERNS, THREE HUNTING PARTIES gath all heavily armed.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 4g. Each PARTY consists of FOUR or FIVE PEASANTS/HUNTERS on horseback; ONE HOUNDSMAN, on foot, each restraining FOUR HOUNDS on short leashes; along with... ...Sir John and Fitzgerald heading up PARTY ONE; Strickla and Col. Montford leading PARTY TWO; and finally, Lawrenc and Dr. Lloyd joining PARTY THREE. All are on their HORSE

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I've been here many times before. On the savannahs and in the jungles of the Dark Continent. I have a feeling you will learn what it is to pit yourself against a worthy adversary tonight. Remember... never underestimate your prey.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: This fog complicates matters, to say the least. If, as legend claims, the werewolf strikes at midnight... (looks at POCKET WATCH) ....won't be long now. Godspeed. As everyone begins to MOVE OUT... Sir John makes sure to pass close to Lawrence, staring hi down, while Lawrence tries to pretend not to notice. Each group begins heading in a different direction. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deep in bleak, foggy FOREST, Sir John's hunting party slo moves through, following their Houndsman and dogs. Before long, the hounds begin BARKING excitedly. The Houndsman looks nervously back to Sir John. Sir John holds up one finger. The Houndsman releases one dog, which goes RUNNING... Quickly disappearing in the fog. Sir John, Fitzgerald and the Hunters ride to give chase. FOLLOW: Sir John's party moving quickly, guided by the BARKING, avoiding TREES and ducking BRANCHES in the mist. They charge down a HILLSIDE, halting as they come upon th hound barking and growling at a large, impenetrable BRAMB

dialogues.speaker: FITZGERALD
dialogues.text: Something's in there. Sir John holds up a hand, keeping the others back. He and Fitzgerald warily advance, PISTOLS aimed... Behind, the Hunters aim RIFLES, targeting the thicket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dog's still barking furiously at the bramble. Suddenly, a FOX leaps out, bolting away. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEN guard the WINDOWS. CHILDREN sleep in BLANKETS on PEWS and on the floor. VILLAGERS stand in worried little group Pastor Fisk stands on the ALTAR STAIRS, reading his BIBLE Gwen is seated in the front pew, staring with tired eyes. Kendall's beside, having fallen asleep on Gwen's shoulder A CLOCKTOWER BELL is HEARD TOLLING from outside. EVERYONE begins talking, whispering. Pastor Fisk closes the Bible, looking up. Gwen looks up, troubled.

dialogues.speaker: EXT, BLACKMOOR VILLAGE, TOWN SQUARE
dialogues.text: Over the empty SQUARE, the CLOCKTOWER TOLLS. 12 O'CLOCK. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOG'S THICKER. Strickland and Col. Montford's party trail their Houndsman and his rooting hounds across the open ground of the heath. From across the moors: the HOWL of t WEREWOLF is HEARD, not far away. The hounds go crazy. All in the party react, wide-eyed. Strickland looks to the terrified Col. Montford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elsewhere, Lawrence and Dr. Lloyd's group traverses a FIE leaving FORESTS at their back. The WEREWOLF'S long, almos mournful CRY reaches them from FAR BEHIND. Everyone freez

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: To the south! The moors! They all turn, riding back toward the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dogs bark wildly, straining at their leashes. Strickland, Col. Montford and the others struggle to cont their jittery horses. Another HOWL is HEARD, very near no just beyond the enveloping blanket of fog.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MONTFORD
dialogues.text: Saints preserve us! It's here!

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: (to the Houndsman) Now, man! Loose them! The Houndsman obeys, letting his hounds free... All four dogs race off together, gone from sight in the m Strickland's party LISTENS, weapons at ready as... Unseen in the miasmic gloom: the HOUNDS are HEARD BARKING they converge; GROWLING furiously as they're ATTACKING something! From the SOUNDS of the ensuing, violent STRUGGLE, there comes the savage ROAR of the WEREWOLF! The DOGS YELP, being slaughtered...being silenced. FROM THE FOG: one DOG'S mutilated BODY is THROWN... Landing with a bloody-wet THUD before the spooked horses! FROM THE FOG: a lone, surviving hound SPRINTS OUT, fleein Strickland raises his PISTOL -- SHOOTING! Col. Montford a the others join -- BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! -- FIRING blindly in the fog bank where the hounds were killed.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Hold your fire! Wait! Everyone stops shooting. Listening. The WEREWOLF'S ROAR comes from elsewhere, farther.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: It's on the run! Come on! Strickland rides towards that last roar... Followed without hesitation by the four other Hunters. Leaving only Col. Montford gaping down at the ripped-up HOUND bleeding-out on the ground before him. i Col. Montford decides, turning his horse, retreating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: Lawrence riding hard, leading his team through th fog-shrouded forest with Dr. Lloyd close behind. Suddenly, Lawrence's horse rears up... Lawrence is nearly thrown, struggling with the reins.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As Dr. Lloyd and the Hunters halt, Lawrence leaps down. Lawrence walks, holding up his LANTERN to REVEAL... i A bloody WHITE STALLION lying DEAD, utterly eviscerated. Sir John's horse, clearly killed by the werewolf

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Good Christ.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (grim realization) My father's horse.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Lawrence, over here! Doctor Lloyd climbs down from his horse, going to a nearb BODY lying face down. Lawrence runs over just as Dr. Lloy turns the CORPSE. It's a dead HUNTER from Sir John's part covered in blood, eyes and mouth wide, his face CLAWED.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: One of your father's men! Lawrence stumbles back, swallowing sickness, dismayed. The HOWL of the WEREWOLF is HEARD, distant.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (to HUNTERS) You men, ride on to the moors. Go! Their five fellow Hunters obey, riding. Lawrence pulls his PISTOL, striding onward, gun in one ha and lantern in the other, searching the forest.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (shouting) Father! Father!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: as Strickland and his party's four Hunters GALLOP HEADLONG, pistols raised, into the swirling mists...

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: Show yourself, monster! Suddenly, a BEASTLY FIGURE rises quickly FROM THE FOG... PULLING DOWN the Hunter to Strickland's right! Strickland and the remaining Hunters ride on, oniy just realizing... seeing the now riderless horse amongst them.

dialogues.speaker: STRICKLAND
dialogues.text: No! Behind, the MAN is HEARD CRYING OUT in agony!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOLLOW: as Strickland splits off to ride back. He's advancing quickly on SOMETHING barely seen in the gloom.. The BEAST is hunkered over the HUNTER'S prone BODY! As Strickland SHOOTS, the BEAST leaps away! Gone. Strickland halts his horse, looking upon the eviscerated, dead HUNTER whose SEVERED ARM lies near.

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE ACROSS THE MOORS
dialogues.text: Col. Montford rides, glances back, spurring his horse on. He thunders past an old, crooked SIGN without noticing it Over SKULL and CROSSBONES: "Keep out! Dangerous bog!" FURTHER ON, Col. Montford's glancing back once more when horse suddenly SPLATTERS into the BOG -- tripped up and falling -- THROWING Col. Montford! Col. Montford lands with a SPLASH in swampy QUAGMIRE ! He gasps, rolling onto his belly, knee-and-elbow-deep in muck. He looks up to see his horse, nearer the bog's edge splashing its way to solid ground.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MONTFORD
dialogues.text: No! Come back here! Come back! The horse runs off. Col. Montford looks around, begins struggling to extricate himself, desperately afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence and Dr. Lloyd are on foot, calling out...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Father!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Sir John! They soon come upon another grisly discovery... One more HUNTER from Six John's party, lying dead on his back; half of him, actually, since his LEGS ARE GONE .

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: What Hell have we wandered into? A GURGLING CRY is HEARD ahead. Lawrence and Dr. Lloyd loo running towards the sound. Someone's lying half-propped u against a tree... It's Fitzgerald, bloody and barely alive, clutching his RUPTURED throat. Lawrence and Dr. Lloyd fall to their kne peside him. Fitzgerald tries to speak, unintelligible.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: We're here, Fitzgerald, we're here. Can you help him, Doctor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Lloyd presses his hand over Fitzgerald's, trying t stem the flow of BLOOD POURING out between their fingers.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: His... his throat's torn open. He's lost so much blood... th 4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: © Fitzgerald GURGLES urgently at Lawrence, brings up his hand, in a fist, trying to give Lawrence SOMETHING.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Isn't there anything we can do? Dr. Lloyd sadly shakes his head. Fitzgerald makes a last attempt to speak, BLOOD BUBBLING from his lips. His eyes roll up. With a final, rattling gasp, he slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One HUNTER SLAMS the ground, holding his BLOODY FACE as.. He's DRAGGED AWAY, his foot caught in his horse's stirrup

dialogues.speaker: NEARBY
dialogues.text: Strickland turns his horse, hearing the SOUND of that MAN SCREAMS traveling out there in the fog. GUNSHOTS echo. SOMEONE else is YELLING, followed by the WEREWOLF'S ROAR! Strickland's unnerved, looking all directions... Not far away, the grouping of STONE MONOLITHS is vaguely silhouetted. Strickland rides there.

dialogues.speaker: AMONGST THE MONOLITHS
dialogues.text: Strickland rides to the center of the ancient, ceremonial circle. The WEREWOLF'S ROAR nears. The FIGURE of the WEREWOLF materializes, MOVING quickly, outside the circle Strickland SHOOTS between the monoliths, targeting the elusive BEAST, till the revolver's EMPTY. Strickland leaps down from his horse, pulls his RIFLE and AMMO BAG from the saddle. He SLAPS his horse's flank, sen the horse running. Strickland shoulders the rifle... He turns, peering down the sight; keeps turning and aimin frantically trying to cover all possible entry points. FROM BEHIND: the SHAPE of WEREWOLF appears, CHARGING straight at the oblivious Strickland... Strickland is THROWN, flailing -- SMASHING with bone- crushing force against one of the immutable monoliths! He crumples limply to the ground. Certainly dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN THE QUAGMIRE: the more Col. Montford struggles, the deeper he sinks. He's in nearly up to his waist in the grasping muck, terror and exhaustion taking their toll.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MONTFORD
dialogues.text: Help! Someone! Help me, please! The only answer...the WEREWOLF'S HOWL. Montford gives a S

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Lloyd places his jacket over Fitzgerald's corpse. Lawrence notices something peculiar, kneeling. He takes a PIECE of CLOTH from Fitzgerald's fist. Lawrence stands, studying the frayed piece of CLOTH. We DO NOT SEE yet what Lawrence is looking at, but Lawren is Shaken, Tooking at it in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: What is it? Lawrence? Lawrence closes his hand on the cloth, his mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: That night, Doctor... the night Constable Nye was killed. You and Colonel Montford left Talbot Hall together with my father...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Yes, yes...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You... you said, that when you all got back to the village, the constable was already dead...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Yes, he was.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (urgently) Tell me you were never apart from my father that night! Tell me that you were with him until the morning!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: No. No, we...we had split up earlier, to cover more ground...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 5é. Lawrence is mortified, chilled by this revelation.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: We did meet up again in the village, but as I'd said, it was almost dawn by the time we all got there. What's this about? Lawrence runs to where their horses are tied... He scrambles up onto his horse,. RIDING away.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Where are you going?!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOORS, AT THE BOG
dialogues.text: Col. Montford struggles in the mire. It's hopeless. The WEREWOLF is HEARD ROARING. Col. Montford pulls his muddy PISTOL, trying to turn his body, trying to take aim FROM THE FOG: the SHAPE of the WEREWOLF materializes. Col. Montford points his gun, blubbering. The WEREWOLF'S guttural, O.S. BREATHING is HEARD growing CLOSER. Col. Montford's hand is SHAKING badly. He tries to steady the gun in both hands, tears streaking down his dirty cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MONTFORD
dialogues.text: No...no...no...no...no... The gun WOBBLES so wildly in his grip as to be useless. As the 0.S. WEREWOLF GROWLS, Col. Montford decides...

dialogues.speaker: COLONEL MONTFORD
dialogues.text: No, Goddamn you! NO! Montford jams the gun in his mouth, frightened out of his mind, pulls the trigger -- BLAM! -- literally out of his mind as BRAIN and GORE EXPLODE out the back of his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence rides pell-mell across the GREAT LAWN... Taking his horse straight up the front STAIRS of the mans

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence runs in, distraught, at his wit's end.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Father! He runs halfway up the central stairs to the landing. At the top of the stairs, Samson comes to BARK down at Lawre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence's VOICE ECHOES, unanswered. Samson's BARKING. Lawrence despairs, looking at the CLOTH he still holds... It is a TORN SHIRT POCKET bearing the unmistakable TALBOT FAMILY CREST we've seen Sir John wearing many times.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / EXT. TALBOT HALL
dialogues.text: As seen before, Sir John addresses the THREE HUNTING PARTIES, on horseback, gathered on the GREAT LAWN.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I have a feeling you will learn what it is to pit yourself against a worthy adversary tonight. SLOW 200M IN: on Sir John's SHIRT POCKET where, even part obscured by his JACKET, the CREST is easily recognizable.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lawrence closes his fist around the torn pocket, allowing his shock to be overtaken by rage’ and by determination. He bounds back down the stairs, striding towards the open front door, but stops, realizing something. He turns, looking up... at Samson, still BARKING. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence, LANTERN in hand, has Samson on a LEASH, letting the dog lead him from the GARDENS to the FOREST; where we saw Lawrence and Gwen follow Sir John the night before.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FOREST TRAIL
dialogues.text: Lawrence pulls out Sir John's ripped POCKET, giving Samso a good sniff of it. Samson barks, following the scent int the foggy FOREST, quickly leading Lawrence. They pass the eerie Talbot GRAVEYARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Samson and Lawrence enter this clearing. The towering CASTLE RUINS appear menacing in the ghostly mist. Samson guides Lawrence towards the ruins, heading across uneven field of fallen STONES. Samson goes to start BARKI at a large HOLE in the CASTLE WALL. Lawrence pulls Samson's leash, dragging him back. He ties Samson to a downed TREE, pets Samson's head.  58.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CASTLE RUINS
dialogues.text: Lawrence ducks through the HOLE, warily entering a dank, moss-and-ivy-covered PASSAGEWAY. To the right, there's a dead end of fallen DEBRIS; to the left, a narrow STAIRWEL FOLLOW: Lawrence moving urgently DOWN the twisting and turning STAIRWELL, leading with his lantern.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CASTLE CATACOMBS
dialogues.text: Lawrence exits the stairs into a TUNNEL PASSAGEWAY with empty BURIAL CHAMBERS in the walls. He holds his lantern down to examine FOOTPRINTS on the muddy floor. RATS scurr Lawrence runs, ignoring the squealing RATS which flee ahe and peer from the chambers. He approaches an unlocked, wrought IRON GATE across the passageway, pushes through. Lawrence nears the tunnel's end, arriving at... A massive, WOODEN DOOR, reinforced by a METAL SLATS. He marvels at the door's SIX formidable LOCKS and huge CROSSBAR which can be dropped and locked across to keep whatever in. He grasps the door handle, PULLING... It takes tremendous effort to swing the door OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Lawrence enters a large, tomb-like VAULT. Straight ahead, a METAL CHAIR stands amongst a pile of ma heavy CHAINS and SHACKLES. The CHAINS and even the CHAIR itself are BOLTED into the STONE WALL behind. Lawrence approaches. The WALLS and FLOOR around the chair are COVERED in countless deep SCRATCHES. CLAW MARKS. Lawrence lifts his lantern, looking up... More SCRATCHES on the low, stone CEILING. Lawrence turns, looking to the inside of the DOOR. It's covered in METAL PLATING which is CLAWED and DENTED. Lawrence crosses to a far wall, examining... A SHRINE of sorts in a small ALCOVE. Melted WAX on the alcove shelf shows where CANDLES have burnt down amongst wilted FLOWERS under a framed PHOTO bolted into the wall. A PHOTOGRAPH of the lovely Gypsy woman, CARMILLA. CcuT TO: INT. FOREST -- NIGHT i Lawrence runs full out, PISTOL held, sprinting down the l forest trail back towards the -- Suddenly, the WEREWOLF LEAPS out from the dark forest wit @ ROAR -- SLAMMING into Lawrence with violent ferocity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence hits the ground, TUMBLING... The Werewolf ROLLS off, SPRINGING agilely mid-roll... LANDING crouched, half-hidden in the foliage. 1 Lawrence struggles to recover, in great pain as he clutch his left arm which BLEEDS PROFUSELY through his CLAWED OP sleeve. He looks up to see... The Werewolf rises to full height so we finally lay eyes upon him: truly half-man/half-wolf, bipedal, covered in dense, dark FUR with much GREY FUR on his face. He wears Sir John's PANTS and tattered SHIRT. His CLAWED hands, jowls and heaving chest are matted with fresh BLOOD. Sir John's features are recognizable in the Werewolf's frightful visage, especially in the EYES; but there is no humanity there. The Werewolf is an animal. The Werewolf lets out a ear-splitting ROAR, fangs bared! Lawrence looks to his right... Where his PISTOL lies not far away. Lawrence dives towards the gun, reaching... The Werewolf crosses the distance instantly... SMASHING into Lawrence, CLAWS DIGGING IN; TEETH SINKING i Lawrence's shoulder as Lawrence CRIES OUT! The Werewolf THROWS Lawrence... -Lawrence lands, stunned, his CLOTHING further SHREDDED, deep, BLOODY LACERATIONS beneath. Lawrence tries to rise, crawling, trying not to black out The Werewolf comes to STOMP one clawed foot down on Lawrence's back, forcing him to the ground! The Werewolf crouches over Lawrence, HOWLING victoriously raising one clawed hand, about to strike the killing blow A RIFLE SHOT is HEARD -- a BULLET EXPLODING into a TREE behind! The Werewolf spins, his attention captured. ACROSS THE FOREST, Doctor Lloyd walks forward, aiming his smoking RIFLE, his horse in the fog behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR LLOYD
dialogues.text: Lawrence! As the Werewolf starts bounding towards Doctor Lloyd... Lawrence manages to lift his head, trying to focus.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Doctor, no... run...!  60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf's storming across the forest. Doctor Lloyd FIRES again. As the Werewolf LEAPS to attack Dr. Lloyd EVERYTHING SPINS as Lawrence is BLACKING OUT...

dialogues.speaker: FADE TO BLACK
dialogues.text: We HEAR DR. LLOYD'S SCREAMS. Then, THUNDER RUMBLING...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / INT. TALBOT HOUSE, BEDROOM
dialogues.text: LIGHTNING FLASHES. Young Lawrence, 10, sits up in his bed looking fearfully to the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the STORM HEARD raging outside, Young Lawrence peers out into the HALLWAY. An ANGUISHED HOWL is HEARD, but it' lost in the SOUND of THUNDER. Was it imagined? Young Lawrence starts tentatively down the long, dark hal LIGHTNING illuminates many big game, ANIMAL HEAD TROPHIES mounted one-after-another: TIGER... ELEPHANT... LION... Young Lawrence walks, trying to ignore the freakish table

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: Young Lawrence slows, looking ahead to... a DOOR ajar. LIQUID pools out from beneath, like black molasses. Young Lawrence moves to push the DOOR OPEN...

dialogues.speaker: IN THIS MASTER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A DARK SHAPE is hunched over, cradling the FIGURE of a WO

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Father... ? The DARK SHAPE turns. LIGHTNING FLASHES across the bloody face of the WEREWOLF! It's Sir John, fully transformed in the Werewolf [without any grey fur], ROARING! The cradled WOMAN'S HEAD falls back limply. It's Lawrence MOTHER; her THROAT TORN OUT, BLOOD FLOWING to the floor. The Werewolf drops her, turning towards Lawrence. Young Lawrence stumbles back in horror... Falling back against his brother, Benjamin, 12, arriving the doorway. Benjamin, likewise terrified, raises a PISTO to the room -- FIRES a BOOMING SHOT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Werewolf's HIT in the side, thrown back, YELPING! As Benjamin adjusts his aim through the doorway... The Werewolf's already FLYING across the darkness -- SMASHING through a WINDOW -- gone into the STORMY NIGHT! WE LOOK STRAIGHT DOWN: upon Benjamin and Lawrence's MOTHE lying in a POOL of BLOOD as the ROOM begins SPIRALING...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mister Talbot? Wake up, sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WATER is THROWN in Lawrence's face, causing him to GASP AWAKE. He's groggy, disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Afternoon, Mister Talbot. We'll have you awake finally, if you please. Angry SHOUTS and EXALTATIONS ECHO from elsewhere. As Lawrence tries to regain his senses, we REVEAL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence is in a small, filthy ASYLUM CELL, seated in a WOODEN WHEELCHAIR. He's shirtless, with all the bruised, raw, werewolf-inflicted WOUNDS across his ARMS, SHOULDERS and CHEST sewn up in heavy twine STITCHES. Lawrence panic

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: What... what is this...? He struggles, his ARMS and LEGS BOUND to the chair. Bearded, bespectacled DOCTOR HENDRICK, in a dirty LAB COA watches. A CREEPY GUARD stands holding the WATER BUCKET.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: What the hell is this!?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Calm yourself, Mister Talbot, or I'll be forced to put you back under. Lawrence realizes he's unable to break free, helpless.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: My name is Doctor Hendrick. You've been committed to The Lambeth Asylum, | London. Not your first visit with t us, apparently. CONTINUED i  62.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: No. That's... that's not possible... This isn't happening!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Let's please try not to upset ourselves. You are here for your own good, after all. (to CREEPY GUARD) Bring him.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ASYLUM CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Creepy Guard pushes Lawrence in the squeaky wheelchair as Doctor Hendrick walks alongside. They pass other INMATES' CELLS. Lawrence is in a state of numb, horrified disbelie

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: You tried to kill yourself. Your father brought you to us. You are gravely injured, not just physically, but mentally as well. We've had to keep you heavily sedated, lest you tear loose your stitches again.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: How long have I been here?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: A fortnight now. Spent ranting. Raving. You are severely delusional. Lawrence glimpses INMATES in their cells: filthy, half-na MEN, CRYING, spouting GIBBERISH and/or gesticulating wild

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Your father is a werewolf, you say. You believe your wounds were not self- inflicted, but caused when he attacked you in his... animalistic state. You also claim your father murdered your mother. Do you remember any of this?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (grimly) I remember. I remember everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence is wheeled in. Sir John stands looking up at yellowed CHARTS of HUMAN ANATOMY which cover the walls of this cluttered, disorganized OFFICE. Lawrence strains in angry frustration against his binding

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Sir John.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Doctor. Would it be possible for me to visit privately with my son?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: I suppose, so long as you're careful.

dialogues.speaker: CREEPY GUARD
dialogues.text: I'll be right outside in the hallway, Sir, if he should become agitated. Hendrick and Creepy Guard go. Sir John looks to Lawrence.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I tried warn you. I told you not to join the hunt.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Where's Gwen?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Gone. Probably somewhere here in London. What does it matter?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Doctor Lloyd?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Killed. Saving you, it seems. Dead along with Strickland and Colonel Montford.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You killed them.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Apparently. Though, only you and I know that. To everyone else, we and some peasants were the few survivors.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You... you killed mother. This troubles Sir John. He nods, solemnly remembering.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. So long ago... (pause) It's like a vague memory of a nightmare. A nightmare that began on a fateful African expedition. Kenya, 1863. Where the hunter became the hunted. What manner of creature attacked me, I did not know...  64.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / EXT. AFRICAN PLAIN
dialogues.text: By FULL MOON light, with his CAMP in the distance, Younge Sir John, RIFLE up, stalks through waist-deep GRASSLANDS. A huge WEREWOLF SPRINGS up from the bush Sir John wheels, FIRING! -- too late as the fearsome, WEREWOLF is already upon him, SCREECHING!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I barely fought the thing off, but not before I was bitten. So when I returned to Blackmoor and my family, to recover from my wounds... I had no idea a demon slumbered inside me. In my very blood.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / EXT. TALBOT HALL, MASTER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: The bloody-faced WEREWOLF that Sir John has become drops MOTHER'S BODY, turning towards Young Lawrence in the door

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Sir John is truly remorseful.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: At the time, I was fully prepared to take my own life. How could I not, after what I had done? Except... it was not me. (looks to Lawrence) When the transformation comes, I cease to exist. I have no control over the beast... nor recollection of its actions, afterwards. I was as much a witness to the tragedy of your mother's death as you were.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Is that what you tell yourself?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Believe what you want. I mourn her every day. (looking around) i As for this place... I brought you here then, to heal your broken mind. It's where you built what memory of i her death your sanity could accept. | (pause) Meanwhile, I persuaded your brother to aid me. So that before the next | full moon... I (more) i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He and I had labored to create such a prison that could, contain the werewolf.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / INT. CASTLE RUINS, VAULT
dialogues.text: Younger Sir John, shirtless, is seated in the METAL CHAIR saw earlier. He's SHACKLED and CHAINED, sweating, waiting

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Every month since, I have imprisoned myself.

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK / INT. CASTLE RUINS, VAULT -
dialogues.text: Young Sir John is CHAINED down, in MID-TRANSFORMATION! He's SCREAMING in pain, FUR GROWING across his quaking bo as he struggles to break free of the tangle of CHAINS!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Once each month at least, and twice in those months, we soon discovered, when a second moon on the cusp of the wax or wane is whole enough to overtake me.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Ben knew, all this time.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Benjamin had always been the one person in my life who remained steadfast by my side. Together, we were able to carve out a life for me, despite my incurable affliction. We kept my bestial alter-ego at bay.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Until now. Until Carmilla. Sir John looks to Lawrence.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I saw the vault in the castle ruins. I saw the shrine you made to her. it was never Benjamin who had the affair with the Gypsy woman. It was you.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ben was not himself once Carmilla was jailed, because he knew that you were the adulterer. That's why he had been seen arguing with her... why he visited her. He knew Carmilla carried your child.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: And look what the Philistines did to her. Her vile husband beat her bloody before bringing her to Strickland, and yet she was the one jailed. And for what Crime? Love. For love! For that selfsame failing, I was expected to be brought forth and pilloried. Made a pariah! For daring to know love yet one last time in my life!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Except you let this happen when you refused to come forward.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Untrue! I did everything I could to free Carmilla...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Everything but accept responsibility!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: If I came forward, they never would have let it end! She gave them a name, as I told her to. The next night would have passed without incident. I would have made certain of that. She should have been released to leave with her tribe! I was willing to lose her, if that's what it took. Against every emotion in my heart, I would've watched her walk out of my life, even carrying my own child! So long she was free! (fury growing) You saw. You saw how the good villagers of Blackmoor held their tongues while Strickland paraded Carmilla before them! After so many years of my protecting every man, woman and child from the abomination inside me! To what end? So I should have to watch as their persecutions drove her to her death...!?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You've...you've gone mad... 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: i

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: To hell with each and every one of them. Let them mount whatever defense they can manage... till either Blackmoor is dead... or I am.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Can't you see that it's driven you mad!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: You may be right. Absolutely. But, what concern is it of yours anymore? You've been bitten. You must know what that means. Lawrence does know, desolate, straining in his bindings.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: It would have been God's mercy if you weren't discovered alive, but you were. You survived. (long pause) There's only one gesture of kindness I can show you now. Sir John produces a STRAIGHT RAZOR, shows its blade.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Keep it hidden. Till a time comes when you are alone and can use it. Sir John comes to place the closed RAZOR in Lawrence's bo hand, so Lawrence can palm it.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Farewell, son. Farewell. Sir John walks towards the door. Lawrence is demoralized, but takes a deep breath, mustering one last defiance.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Before you go, I want you to know... I know now that you killed Ben. Sir John stops, keeping his back to Lawrence.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: He never would have helped you unleash the werewolf. He would have fought you. And so you killed him, that very first night, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I couldn't have, could I? Since he went missing the day after.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: No. When Gwen said he was still at Talbot Hall after the first murder, she was trusting in what you told everyone. But, she was in London. Ben had sent her away. Because he knew what you were about to do! Sir John still faces away, betraying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Benjamin left. He's deserted me, just as you deserted me before him...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You probably didn't even know till you found him in the morning, isn't that so...?! (venting fury) And where did you hide the body?! Where did you bury my brother?!! The DOOR SLAMS OPEN as Creepy Guard and Dr. Hendrick ente

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: He gave his whole life to you; your loving, loyal son... and you murdered him! YOU MURDERED HIM!! Creepy Guard comes to grab Lawrence in a headlock. Dr. Hendrick stabs a HYPODERMIC NEEDLE into Lawrence's ne Lawrence's hand SPASMS... Dropping the RAZOR to the floor. Dr. Hendrick pushes the hypo's plunger. As Lawrence CRIES OUT, we ZOOM IN: entering HIS PUPIL -- into PITCH BLACK..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From BLACKNESS: a gaslight LAMP FLICKERS to life, back-— lighting a stage-craft FULL MOON within a familiar, painted STAGE BACKDROP of crooked trees and grim sky. Lawrence steps INTO FRAME, wearing a STRAITJACKET.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: To be or not to be. That is the question! Whether 'tis... He overacts, trying to be HEARD over growing O.S. GROWLIN

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Whether 'tis nobler in the mind to suffer!! The slings and arrows of outrageous fortune!

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Shouting over the still GROWING SOUND of monstrous SNARL and GNASHING, Lawrence looks out to see... He stands before an S.R.O. AUDIENCE made up entirely of a manner of MALE and FEMALE WEREWOLVES in FANCY DRESS; all them ravenously consuming dismembered HUMAN REMAINS. The WEREWOLVES tear into severed ARMS and LEGS, some fighting over bloody ENTRAILS, while down the CENTER AISL walks the transformed SIR JOHN; fully a WEREWOLF, in a fi SUIT, smoking a CIGAR and CLAPPING his clawed hands.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN WEREWOLF
dialogues.text: Bravo! Bravo! My son, ladies and gentlemen! My son! The stage's RED CURTAIN FALLS CLOSED behind Lawrence as h backs fearfully away, slipping through the center slit... ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE CURTAIN: Lawrence finds himself.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOORS
dialogues.text: IN A DENSE FOG. Lawrence walks, leaving the curtain behin

dialogues.speaker: OLD MALEVA'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Even a man who is pure in heart and says his prayers by night... There's a huge SHAPE slowly approaching in the FOG.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MALEVA'S VOICE, (0.8.)
dialogues.text: ++. May become a wolf when the wolfsbane blooms... and the autumn moon is bright. Old Maleva arrives on horseback, in full GYPSY REGALIA.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Why are you here?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MALEVA
dialogues.text: I pledged to seek you out, Lawrence Talbot... if the spirits gave an answer to your question. From across the beyond, the answer came... (pause) Benjamin is with your mother now.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: My mother?

dialogues.speaker: OLD MALEVA
dialogues.text: They are together.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: My... mother is dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old Maleva guides her horse past Lawrence, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MALEVA
dialogues.text: Perhaps you will join them soon. In a moment, she's gone in the the WHITENESS of the FOG.

dialogues.speaker: IN A PADDED ASYLUM CELL
dialogues.text: WHITE WALLS are covered in old blood and worse. Lawrence sleeps, in his STRAITJACKET, curled fetal, DREAMING...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE'S DREAM
dialogues.text: We're RUNNING quickly through misty, gnarled FOREST...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CELL
dialogues.text: Lawrence rolls, twitching. Areas of FUR are beginning to crop up on his face. His VEINS THROB. His grinding TEETH are becoming SHARP FANGS. He's partially transformed!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE'S DREAM
dialogues.text: RUNNING fast, from FOREST to the open MOORS...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CELL
dialogues.text: Lawrence rolls back the other way, now returned to NORMAL He continues stirring, feverish.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE'S DREAM
dialogues.text: RUNNING across the GREAT LAWN, to TALBOT HOUSE, where eve WINDOW is filled with a bright, HELLISH RED GLOW.

dialogues.speaker: IN_A WATER TANK
dialogues.text: Lawrence PLUNGES UPSIDE DOWN into a GLASS TANK of MURKY WATER! His eyes open, bulging, as he awakens, mortified. He's in up to his waist, straitjacketed. Lawrence squirms, left under for an interminably long tim As he YELLS, spewing BUBBLES, he's suddenly YANKED UPWARD

dialogues.text: Creepy Guard turns the WHEEL of a CHAIN and PULLEY SYSTEM which hoists Lawrence, by his CHAINED feet, up from the Hydro-Therapy TANK. Lawrence hangs, GASPING.

dialogues.text: (to Creepy Guard) Again. Lawrence barely has time to react as Creepy Guard kicks t release on the PULLEY-SYSTEM'S WHEEL, dropping Lawrence..

dialogues.text: Lawrence SPLASHES under! He twists, desperately afraid. More endless seconds tick by, till he simply can't hold h breath any more. He's BLACKING OUT, his eyes rolling back

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE'S DREAM
dialogues.text: We WALK down the familiar UPSTAIRS HALLWAY of the TALBOT MANSION. Where once were the big game, animal head TROPHIES, now hang stuffed and mounted HUMAN HEADS... The discolored, gory HEADS of FITZGERALD... CONSTABLE NYE STRICKLAND... DOCTOR LLOYD... COLONEL MONTFORD; each ,wit their NAME engraved on.a BRASS PLAQUE beneath. FURTHER ON, we approach the MASTER BEDROOM DOOR, HEARING WOMAN'S CRIES. The door OPENS by itself...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MASTER BEDROOM
dialogues.text: By OIL LAMP LIGHT, a WEREWOLF attacks a WOMAN on the BED. It's Gwen on the bed, struggling, SCREAMING. The WEREWOLF is on top of her, TEARING at her clothing. Gwen pounds on the creature's chest, trying to fight him off, in tears.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No... no... Lawrence, no! The Werewolf abruptly reacts, stopping. We can see it now in his EYES -- it is Lawrence. The Werewolf turns, seeing himself in a huge, ornate MIRROR across the room... IN THE MIRROR: it's human LAWRENCE reflected, sweaty, hav forced himself onto Gwen who lies under him, weeping. Reflected-Lawrence grabs the LAMP, enraged, THROWING it - SHATTERING the mirror as the LAMP EXPLODES into FLAMES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence lifts his bedraggled head, regaining consciousne He is once again BOUND to his WHEELCHAIR. He's barefoot, dressed in an institutional SHIRT and PANTS. Hendrick stands flanked by Creepy Guard.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Good evening, Mister Talbot. Against my better judgement, I've decided to allow a visitation. I hope it may have a calming influence. Lawrence is groggily trying to shake out the cobwebs.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: You'll only have a moment. A young, pasty-faced INTERN escorts Gwen in, waits by the door. Gwen looks at Lawrence, hand to her mouth, anguishe

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Lawrence.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Gwen? Is it truly you?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Oh, Lawrence... I've been trying for weeks to be allowed to see you. Are you alright? What have they done? (to Dr. Hendrick) Why is he tied down like this?!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: For his own safety, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: It's alright, Gwen. You're...you're with your family? Here in the city?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Yes. We're doing everything we can. Your father... he brought you without telling anyone. You were hurt, nearly killed. He took you from Talbot Hall in the middle of the night. (sorrowful pause) I... I thought I might never find you again... Gwen reaches to touch Lawrence's face.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: No physical contact with the patient if you please, Miss.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I... I can't tell if you're a dream or if I'm awake. I'm sorry. Tears roll down Lawrence's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: We're going to get you out of here somehow. We'll do whatever it takes. We'll go to doctors, solicitors...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: No. It's too late. It's too late for me now.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: What...what are you talking about? What happened? What happened that night?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: That's enough, Miss Conliffe. I can see this was a mistake... Doctor Hendrick nods and Pasty Intern steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Gwen. Promise me. , Don't ever go back there... Pasty Intern begins pulling Gwen away. She's distraught.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Don't go back to Blackmoor, whatever you do. Swear to me that you won't!

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: I...I promise... (to Pasty Intern) Let go of me! No! Lawrence! Gwen's looking back as she's pulled away. Gone. Lawrence despairs. Doctor Hendrick's angry.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Calming influence indeed. (looks at his WATCH, to Creepy Guard) Bring him. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creepy Guard wheels Lawrence to the center of the room, b an OPERATING TABLE, under central GAS LAMPS. Many empty CHAIRS are arranged in surrounding circles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Hendrick stands. TWO other DOCTORS sit in the fron row.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: (to Lawrence) My associates and I... we've been quite eager for this night to arrive. We consider you a particularly fascinating case.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (bitterly) I'm flattered. Creepy Guard walks back to the only door while sorting through the MANY KEYS on his KEYCHAIN. He LOCKS the door.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: What you're suffering from is called "Lycanthropy." Simply put, it's the belief that you will be transformed into a wolf... that you will take on certain physical characteristics of the wolf. There are legends of werewolfism as far back as Greek mythology, and beyond. Across almost every culture, you will find some version of the "changling" delusion. Dr. Hendrick paces. Creepy Guard returns to observe.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: There were ancient, primal tribes whose warriors believed that consuming the flesh of those they defeated would grant them their enemies strengths. The Norse Berserkers would adorn themselves in animal hides before each battle. In the Medieval Ages, throughout Europe, thousands of persons, even tens of thousands, were put to death as convicted werewolves. (pause) We live in a more enlightened age. (to 2ND DOCTOR) Doctor, if you wouldn't mind... 2nd Doctor rises, crossing to a tall WINDOW.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: We are here tonight, to illustrate conclusively that your fears are guite irrational. 2nd Doctor pulls aside the CURTAINS, revealing a view of NIGHT SKY and the high FULL MOON shining brightly.

dialogues.speaker: CONT INUED
dialogues.text: Realization strikes Lawrence like a thunderbolt.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: What...what are you doing...?

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: We are simply going to remain in this room together, all night. And once you've witnessed that the full moon holds no sway over you; that you remain a perfectly ordinary human being...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: my God...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: You will have taken your first small step down the long road to recovery.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You can't do this... you can't!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Lycanthropy is a disease of the mind existing somewhere in the deep recesses of your thoughts. Yes, to you, it seems very real!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: It is real! You've got to believe me!

dialogues.speaker: . DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: You've suffered quite traumatic personal experiences, Mister Talbot, we're well aware. You hate your father. Your mother committed suicide. Therefore, your father must be to blame for her death... Lawrence is fed up, begins struggling violently, trying pull his arms and legs free of the wheelchair!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: You witnessed your mother's self mutilation! Your young mind, unable to accept it, created a fantastical truth; that your father is literally a monster! 75. to Lawrence is unable to free himself, SWEATING, BREATHING H

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: But, your father is not a werewolf. You were not bitten by a werewolf. (more)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will not become a werewolf anymore than... than I will sprout wings and fly out that window! 2nd and 3rd DOCTOR, and especially Creepy Guard, CHUCKLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the FOGGY CITY, at the HOUSES OF PARLIAMENT, majes BIG BEN shows 12:00. The CLOCKTOWER TOLLS... TOLLS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hendrick sits beside the other doctors. (BIG BEN can HEARD faintly TOLLING MIDNIGHT in the B.G.)

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Tonight, we will sit and watch the evening passing uneventfully.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Tonight you will sit and watch me become a werewolf, and then I will kill you all! Please, listen... sedate me! Lock me up! Kill me! Lawrence looks down to see... VEINS on the back of his hands THROB; tiny HAIRS GROW!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Do something, anything, I'm begging you! You have to -- Lawrence doubles over, suddenly in excruciating pain! He jerks back in the wheel chair CRYING OUT!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: It's... HAPPENING...! Doctor Hendrick and the other doctors watch, unimpressed.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: It's your imagination, Mister Talbot. All in your vivid imagination! Lawrence CRIES OUT, hyperventilating, TREMBLING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Hendrick and associates watch in stupefied terror. Lawrence throws his head back, SCREAMING! FUR'S GROWING o from his face and jowls while his TEETH become sharp FANG Creepy Guard's slack-jawed, backing to the door. Lawrence's FACE MUTATES into the lurid, monstrously lupin face of THE WOLFMAN; his long SCREAM becoming the raging, guttural ROAR of the Wolfman!

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Bloody Hell! Dr. Hendrick, 2nd Doctor and 3rd Doctor make a mad scramb for the door, where... Creepy Guard's already beginning a desperate search through his overburdened KEYCHAIN. The transmutation now complete, the Wolfman struggles against the STRAPS holding him to the wheelchair! AT THE LOCKED DOOR, Creepy Guard's frantically trying to find the KEY! The three doctors are BANGING on the door, YELLING, trying to pull it open! Dr. Hendrick wrests the KEYCHAIN from Creepy Guard's grasp.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Give me those keys, you imbecile! The Wolfman YANKS his arms and legs free, rising. 2nd Doctor sees this, looks up, across the room... There's a LADDER built into the wall, leading to a SKYLIG 2nd Doctor runs towards the ladder. Wolfman reacts, enraged, THROWING the WHEELCHAIR... The WHEELCHAIR SMASHES 2nd Doctor against the wall! He slumps, trailing a wide SMEAR of BLOOD. Wolfman ROARS, heading for the others. Hendrick tries one KEY in the door's lock... doesn't work Creepy Guard sees the Wolfman coming.

dialogues.speaker: 3RD DOCTOR
dialogues.text: Hurry, Hendrick, hurry! : Creepy Guard gathers his nerve, turning to face the Wolfm reaching to take his heavy TRUNCHEON from his belt. With YELL of bravado, Creepy Guard charges, the club raised... The Wolfman greets him with a swift and bloodying BACKHAN SWIPE -- sends Creepy Guard CARTWHEELING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Creepy Guard TOPPLES the OPERATING TABLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wolfman LEAPS across the distance... Lands on Creepy Guard to begin TEARING HIM APART! AT THE DOOR, Dr. Hendrick inserts another KEY...

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Got it! As he turns the KEY, it SNAPS OFF in the LOCK.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Oh boy. By the OPERATING TABLE (which blocks our view of most of gory carnage), the Wolfman straightens, BLOOD-SOAKED, hav finished with Creepy Guard. Dr. Hendrick begins POUNDING the door's small, circular WINDOW. 3rd Doctor looks around, frantic, sees... The Wolfman stalking towards them.

dialogues.text: ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE DOOR: Dr. Hendrick's BLOODIED FI BREAKS the WINDOW! Hendrick presses his face against the small HOLE, jagged glass cutting his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR HENDRICK
dialogues.text: Help! Open this door! Oh, Lord, someone please open this -- Doctor Hendrick is violently PULLED AWAY.

dialogues.text: The FULL MOON is REFLECTED in ONE of the tall WINDOWS hig on the red brick exterior of Lambeth Asylum, and then... The WINDOW SPLINTERS as Dr. Hendrick is THROWN OUT! Followed immediately by the Wolfman LEAPING OUT!
