dialogues.text: (SINGING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Oh... will you walk into my parlor?" Said the Spider to the fly, "It is the prettiest parlor that you ever did spy!" He brings up a soaking BOOT with his stick. It's worth taking, so he shoves it in the SACK slung over his should

dialogues.speaker: RAGPICKER
dialogues.text: "You've only got to pop your head inside of the door, and you'll see many curious things you never saw before, Will you, will you walk in, pretty Fly?" From behind him, the Wolfman's HOWL ECHOES, distant. It gives Ragpicker pause: He waits, then continues, leery

dialogues.speaker: RAGPICKER
dialogues.text: "My fine house is always open," said the Spider to the Fly, "I'm glad to have the company of all who go by..." The Wolfman's HOWL is HEARD, very NEAR. Ragpicker spins to look back, aiming his lantern.

dialogues.speaker: RAGPICKER
dialogues.text: (quietly, afraid) | "Will you... will you walk in, pretty ! Fly...? Will you grant me one sweet kiss, dear," says the Spider to the : Fly." | DOWN THE TUNNEL: coming slowly into view... is the LIGHT the LANTERN reflected in the Wolfman's TWO RED EYES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ragpicker turns, FLEEING down the tunnel... FOLLOW: as he's SPLASHING through the muck, TURNING this and that... navigating the MAZE of TUNNELS, not looking b

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON
dialogues.text: Ragpicker stumbles from one TUNNEL, entering into a main artery INTERSECTION. WATER'S POURING in from everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: RAGPICKER
dialogues.text: (uncertain) Which way... which way...?! The RATS scurrying along the walkways are choosing the largest tunnel; moving the same direction as the WATER'S INCREASED FLOW. Ragpicker follows their lead.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: Ragpicker sloshes along, FALLING in the RUSH of WATER, regaining his footing, keeping his lantern aloft. He halts, crestfallen, shining the lantern ahead...

dialogues.speaker: RAGPICKER
dialogues.text: Lordie. All the rats are disappearing through HOLES in the tunnel's aged brickwork, while beyond that... The TUNNEL itself ends at an OUTLET which is criss~-cross by a latticework of METAL BARS, so that while the WATER'S RUSHING out, for Ragpicker it's a DEAD END. Ragpicker aims his lantern back up the tunnel, against th current. Before long, the RED EYED Wolfman can be seen creeping into the LIGHT, SNARLING lowly. As Ragpicker bac away, we PULL BACK: through the METAL BARS to...

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: ——— EE At the SEWER'S OUTLET, we HEAR only the RUSH of the WATER CASCADING OUT into the THAMES along with the SOUNDS of th CITY as the murky WATER begins FLOWING RED with BLOOD. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: EEE EEE SANK,
dialogues.text: TWO uniformed CONSTABLES patrol a WALKWAY along the Thame Across the RIVER, massive SMOKESTACKS disgorge black clou to the sky. 1st Constable carries a LANTERN, noticing...

dialogues.speaker: 1ST CONSTABLE
dialogues.text: Hold on. What's this here...? He points out a WET AREA of RAILING and WALKWAY where it looks like someone's climbed out from the river.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both constables follow the TRAIL of splashed WATER across the walkway to where lst Constable kneels, indicating... Wet, clearly inhuman, CLAWED FOOTPRINTS left by the Wolfm The constables share a look of bewilderment. They follow the WET FOOTPRINTS to STAIRS leading up a WOODED HILLSIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the STAIRWAY, lst and 2nd Constable arrive, surveying the surrounding PARK. They walk, seeing... SOMETHING'S out there in the open space of the LAWN. Still advancing, 2nd Constable takes his BILLY CLUB from belt while 1st Constable puts his WHISTLE to his lips. IN THE LANTERN LIGHT: the Wolfman's on his haunches, crouched forward. He turns, clutching a dripping fistful ORGANS he's pulled from the pried-open CHEST CAVITY of a MALE CORPSE, letting out a ROAR from his blood-dripping m

dialogues.speaker: 2ND CONSTABLE
dialogues.text: What in God's creation...?! The Wolfman rises, moving towards the stupefied constable lst Constable starts BLOWING his WHISTLE! The Wolfman reacts immediately, throwing his hands to his ears. He retreats from the HIGH PITCH WHISTLING.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARK
dialogues.text: The Wolfman runs with a fast, loping gait... Headed for a WOODED AREA ahead with BRIGHT LIGHTS beyond. 1st and 2nd Constable chase, BLOWING their WHISTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Residential. Well-dressed PEDESTRIANS, mostly GENTLEMEN escorting their LADIES, are on the SIDEWALKS. Begging URCHIN CHILDREN wheedle. COACHES cross. A large, multi- passenger OMNIBUS is pulled by a TEAM of HORSES. From the bordering PARK, the Wolfman LEAPS from the TREEL into the street, recoiling in confusion at all the GAS LA LIGHT and ACTIVITY. PEDESTRIANS react. WOMEN SCREAM. The Wolfman runs directly into the path of the OMNIBUS... The horses REAR up, spooked, SCREECHING! The Wolfman flees onward across the street. The horses BOLT, charging forward, picking up speed!  82.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE OMNIBUS
dialogues.text: The omnibus DRIVER pulls on the reins, to no avail. The horses are OUT OF CONTROL, heading for the SIDEWALK..

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SIDEWALK
dialogues.text: As EVERYONE'S fleeing all directions... A wealthy MAN and WOMAN are brutally RUN DOWN!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: The omnibus' horses veer back towards the street, but they're turning too sharply -- THROWING the DRIVER from h perch as the OMNIBUS is TIPPING...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE OMNIBUS
dialogues.text: A DOZEN PASSENGERS all CRY OUT as the OMNIBUS OVERTURNS! EVERYONE'S THROWN! BREAKING WINDOWS rain GLASS SHARDS!

dialogues.speaker: ON THE STREET
dialogues.text: More panicked PEDESTRIANS scatter as... The Wolfman charges straight at one BUILDING, LEAPING... The Wolfman grabs onto the the building's BRICKFACE and begins swiftly scaling the FACADE and WINDOW LEDGES. He's astonishingly agile, using his clawed HANDS and FEET to m quick work of the THREE STORIES.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE ROOFTOP
dialogues.text: The Wolfman pulls himself up, traversing the ROOFTOP 'S E at an effortlessly-balanced sprint, JUMPING... ...landing on all fours on the neighboring, PITCHED ROOF. He quickly climbs that roof to it's peak, moving fleet-footedly along the narrow peak till he once again JUMPS... ..-.TRAVELING an impossible distance... ...to the next ROOFTOP, fleeing on without hesitation or step. And so it goes as he LEAPS from BUILDING... ...to BUILDING, with unerring animal physicality and instinct, against th backdrop of the great, sprawling, London METROPOLIS. cur TO: INT. BALLROOM -- NIGHT i In this elegant BALLROOM, a MASQUERADE BALL takes place. About TWENTY-FIVE COUPLES DANCE to lovely MUSIC played by STRING QUARTET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OTHER surrounding COUPLES stand watching, sipping CHAMPAG EVERYONE is in elaborate COSTUME, musicians included; all wear fanciful ANIMAL MASKS. At long BANQUET TABLES at one end of the room, SERVANTS clear dishes left from a feast. Some COUPLES still linger at the tables, conversing. It's at the giant WINDOWS over the dining tables where -- the Wolfman comes CRASHING IN. The Wolfman lands in the middle of the dancing revellers, grabbing one BIRD-MASKED MAN from behind and reaching aro with one hand to CLAW OPEN THE MAN'S THROAT! BLOOD FOUNTAINS up as the ROARING Wolfman drops the victi The Wolfman starts cutting a bloody swatch of carnage —- ATTACKING ANYONE and EVERYONE within his grasp! It's pandemonium! EVERYONE SCREAMING! MUSIC STOPS disharmoniously. MEN try to protect WOMEN, but... The Wolfman SLASHES at MEN and WOMEN alike with his razor sharp CLAWS -- RIPPING, GOUGING and MAULING -- cutting people up, BLOOD SPRAYING! The Wolfman spins, SWIPING at one WOMAN, gutting her... She drops to her knees, her INTESTINES SLOSHING to the fl EVERYONE'S FLEEING away from the center, but... PEOPLE are falling, getting TRAMPLED! THREE BRAVE COSTUMED MEN .rush forward... A BULL-MASKED MAN attacks the Wolfman, taking a wild swin but the Wolfman grips the man's arm while BITING savagely near the shoulder -- TEARING THE MAN'S ARM OFF! The Wolfman discards the man and the arm as a TIGER-MASKE MAN charges! The Wolfman TOSSES this man far... Tiger-Masked Man lands grotesquely in a twisted heap! A GORILLA-MASKED MAN jumps on the Wolfman from behind, bu the Wolfman immediately THROWS HIM OFF! The man's trying to crawl away, but The Wolfman's on him,

dialogues.speaker: SINKING HIS FANGS INTO THE BACK OF GORILLA-MASKED MAN'S
dialogues.text: HEAD! We can just HEAR the SKULL CRACKING over the man's CRIES as BLOOD POURS out of the MASK'S MOUTH and EYES! The bloody Wolfman rises, spinning to look for who's next An OWL-MASKED MAN SHOVES past others to THROW one of the LAMPS taken from the banquet tables... | OWL-MASKED MAN i Look out! The LAMP SMASHES in front of the Wolfman, FLAMES SPREADIN The Wolfman's freaked out, backing away. CONTINUED i  84. Another LANTERN is HURTLED... It EXPLODES onto the floor! The Wolfman voices his fury, holding up his arms against the FLAMES! The Wolfman retreats... Everyone scatters from his path as he VAULTS over the BANQUET TABLES and begins pulling himself up the cascadin CURTAINS of the shattered WINDOWS. High above, the Wolfman clings to the curtains, KICKS OFF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: from the wall -- SWINGING out above the crimson-stained aftermath below -- HURTLING HIMSELF out into the night! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LONDON STREET, EAST END
dialogues.text: On a sparsely peopled STREET in a poor section, a few DRUNKARDS congregate outside a TAVERN. Wild DOGS wander. A drunk, young LADY-OF-THE-EVENING, in a soiled DRESS, stumbles from the tavern, MUTTERING under her breath. The Young Lady starts down the SIDEWALK, none too steady. She's passing a MAN walking the other way.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LADY
dialogues.text: Pardon, Sir... spare a few bob? As the MAN'S brushing by her...

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG LADY
dialogues.text: Willing to make it worth your while, squire. What do you say? (watching him go) Snotty. Young Lady SPITS after him, walking on. She heads down a dark ALLEYWAY. ACROSS THE STREET, from a DARK ALCOVE: a MAN steps into view. He's handsome, dressed in BLACK, wearing a tall, TO HAT and an enveloping CLOAK reaching almost to the ground He grips a CANE capped by a SILVER, horned DEVIL'S HEAD handle with RUBY EYES. Let's call the man JACK. Jack swiftly crosses towards the ALLEYWAY. As he reaches the opposite sidewalk, he treads upon a discarded NEWSPAPER headlined: "2ND RIPPER VICTIM FOUND!"

dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE ALLEY
dialogues.text: Light FOG hangs low. Young Lady's meandering along, muttering to herself, while... Jack follows, cape flowing looking to be certain no one else is around. Young Lady HEARS Jack's FOOTSTEPS, looking back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sees Jack coming. She walks faster, unnerved. Jack walks faster. Young Lady may be drunk, but she's not stupid. She runs. Handsome Jack strides after, confident she won't escape. He's sweating, excited, with an awful gleam in his eye. JACK'S HAND twists the devil-head top of his CANE and unsheathes a long, glinting KNIFE BLADE. Young Lady's running, deathly afraid, trying to hike up h skirt so she can run faster. Jack's closing fast, when... The Wolfman drops from above... SLAMMING Young Woman to the ground! Behind, Jack stops dead in his tracks, startled. Young Lady's CRIES die quickly as the Wolfman'S DIGGING H TEETH INTO her throat, THRASHING! Jack witnesses, appalled by the sight, sickened.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE MOUTH OF THE ALLEYWAY
dialogues.text: Jack sprints out from the ALLEY, shoving by TWO burly FACTORY WORKERS. The men curse him as he continues fleein Jack trips and FALLS... SPLASHING into an enormous puddle the street, losing his HAT. He scrambles up and keeps running as fast as his legs will carry him. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the distance, on a high TRAIN TRESTLE, we can see THE WOLFMAN making his way along the top of the angular, iron structure. A long TRAIN steams by in the other direction. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOUNDS of EXOTIC BIRDS are HEARD. The Wolfman pulls himse up atop a tall WALL, remains there, crouched, sniffing at the night air. He drops down inside the wall. He's entered a lush GARDEN of sorts, filled with exotic PLANTS and TREES. He moves warily through, hunkered. The Wolfman hesitantly approaches a large, placid POND. He crouches at the water's muddy edge, begins scooping wa to his mouth, drinking, ever watchful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Wolfman drinks, we PULL BACK: beyond IRON BARS to reveal that this GARDEN is actually an enclosed ZOO HABIT which, according to its SIGN holds a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: “Crocodylus niloticus; Nile Crocodile." IN THE ENCLOSURE, Wolfman continues sating his thirst at pond's edge, in a rare moment of quiet calm. He stops drinking, leaning forward to peer curiously into the wate He's transfixed by his own REFLECTION for a long moment. Then, just as the REFLECTION is broken by RIPPLES... An enormous CROCODILE LUNGES UP from the water, reaching his massive jaws to CLAMP DOWN on the Wolfman's leg! The crocodile performs a DEATH ROLL, DRAGGING the Wolfman back with him into deeper water! The Wolfman's YELPING, clawing and fighting back... He SLASHES at the crocodile, managing to extricate his to BLOODY leg from the croc's craggy-toothed mouth. In the frothing water, the two behemoths WRESTLE! It's a brutally violent, life-and-death struggle! The crocodile SLAMS the Wolfman with his powerful tail... The Wolfman lands at the water's edge, dazed. The HISSING crocodile attacks from behind! The Wolfman rolls, barely. avoiding the croc's gnashing j The crocodile twists, snapping after the Wolfman... Wolfman climbs on the crocodile's back, gripping the croc head in both hands -- PULLING with all his might! Kneeled on the crocodile's back, with the savage reptile THRASHING beneath him, the Wolfman's PULLING the crocodil head back further... further still, until finally -- the crocodile's SPINE is HEARD SNAPPING grotesquely! The croc goes MOTIONLESS. The Wolfman releases his grip. The Wolfman rises, spent, staggering away from his defeat foe, bearing BLEEDING WOUNDS from the encounter. The Wolfman lets out a long victory HOWL. From not far away, another HOWL answers. The Wolfman turns, his eyes widening. | He HOWLS again. Several HOWLS reply. |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolfman (favoring his now wounded leg) arrives at a b CIRCULAR CAGE which is home to FIVE full-grown WOLVES. Th wolves pace, excited by Wolfman's presence, HOWLING, YELP
Wolfman's equally excited, circling, watching as the imprisoned wolves follow his every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolfman vaults over the spectator RAILING, getting a grip on the cage's METAL BARS. He presses his face to the bars, puzzling over them, angrily rattling them. The Wolfman starts trying to bend the bars; PULLING at th The wolves pace back and forth, vocalizing frantically. The Wolfman keeps trying, using his inhuman strength -- beginning to BEND the creaking BARS APART! cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the middle of this vast, hilly CEMETERY, with tall GRAVEMARKERS, BURIAL VAULTS and eerie STATUARY for as far the eye can see, there's a SMALL GROUP at work... By LANTERN light, a greasy-faced, shabbily-dressed, middl aged GRAVEROBBER and his FOUR, young STREET URCHIN i accomplices (Artful-Dodger-types), strain at ROPES tied { around a COFFIN they're hoisting up from an exhumed GRAVE They manage to set the heavy COFFIN beside the open grave propping it up on the DIRT MOUND they've dug.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: That's the way, lads. A little bit of effort leads to good things, aren't I always saying? (smiles his CROOKED SMILE) Now... let's see how good! Graverobber pulls the COFFIN LID OPEN. He and the Four Urchins grin in at the CORPSE of the well-dressed MAN.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: Hello, Mister Sir! Glad to meet you! Pleasure's all ours! Graverobber and his urchins LAUGH, setting to work, quick and efficiently removing anything of value; taking RINGS from the man's fingers and CUFF LINKS from his cuffs. Extracting a WATCH FOB and GOLD POCKET WATCH while plucki BUTTONS from the man's SHIRT and SUIT. Graverobber pries open the corpse's mouth, leaning close to look inside. The youngest urchin, blonde~haired and rosy-cheeked, BLONDIE, occupies himself removing the deceased's SHOES. yet notice... that the FIVE 200 WOLVES silently arrive, We PULL BACK: so we see what the graverobbing gang does n taking up positions amongst the neighboring HEADSTONES. | CONT INUED i  86.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: Funny, isn't it; how this here gent who wouldn't've given us the time of day when he was alive... (holds up POCKET WATCH) Is such a generous fellow dead! Graverobber LAUGHS again, but the laugh catches in his throat as he spots one of the wolves. Graverobber stands as the urchins all turn, looking... The wolves have them surrounded.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: Alright, my lads... let's be calm about this... nice and caim... Graverobber licks his lips, looking to a SHOVEL sticking from the dirt mound. Meanwhile, the closest wolf begins edging forward, GROWLING menacingly.

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: On the count of three... run. Graverobber slowly reaches for the shovel, watching as th most aggressive wolf creeps even CLOSER...

dialogues.speaker: 1... 2... 3... RUN
dialogues.text: The urchins scatter! Graverobber grabs the shovel just as the first wolf LEAPS at him! Graverobber SWINGS the shovel, BASHING the wolf aside! The YELPING wolf goes tumbling! The four other wolves all RUN OFF... Following the urchins in different directions. Graverobber raises the shovel, preparing to swing again, he's losing his footing in the loose dirt... He TRIPS backwards over the coffin, coffin LID SLAMMING a he FALLS down into the deep, dark GRAVE! IN THE GRAVE: Graverobber's hurt, groaning, trying to ris DIRT FALLS IN onto him as he's looking up... Just in time to see the COFFIN SLIDING...

dialogues.speaker: GRAVEROBBER
dialogues.text: Bollocks! i The heavy COFFIN SMASHES down -- CRUSHING Graverobber!

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE GRAVEYARD '
dialogues.text: Several urchins run... |

dialogues.speaker: CONT INUED
dialogues.text: ZIG-ZAGGING through HEADSTONES. Two of the wolves race after them!

dialogues.speaker: ELSEWHERE AMONGST THE GRAVESTONES
dialogues.text: Blondie, our favorite urchin, runs for all he's worth, st hugging the dead man's SHOES to his chest. Two ravenous wolves are right behind. Blondie glances back, terrified. Ahead, there are TWO VAULTS close together. It's a tight fit, but Blondie disappears down the NARROW SPACE between them... When the two wolves arrive side-by-side, their attempt to follow becomes a SNARLING FIGHT over right of way.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER ON
dialogues.text: Blondie ducks down in the shadow of a massive GRAVEMARKER pressing against the cold stone, hiding. The SNARL of the wolves is soon HEARD. Blondie watches as, down the ROW of GRAVES, the two wolves arrive, prowling. The wolves SNIFF at the ground, heading Blondie's way. Blondie notices for the first time that he's still got th shoes. He swallows, deciding. Carefully trying to make as little noise as possible, Blondie THROWS one shoe... The SHOE'S HEARD landing a few rows down. The two wolves immediately raise their heads. They rush off in the direction of the sound. Blondie grins, relieved. He stands slowly, craning his ne to make sure the coast is clear. Something WET starts DRIPPING down onto his shoulder. Blondie notices, looking at the droplets... RED droplets. Blondie looks straight up... ABOVE, standing balanced atop of the huge GRAVEMARKER, is the Wolfman leering down. He DROPS, letting out a ROAR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amidst the boundless LONDON CITYSCAPE... The Wolfman climbs towards the peak of the spectacular DO of ST. PAUL'S CATHEDRAL. The Wolfman reaches up at the FULL MOON, HOWLING loudly.. HOWLING with a kind of disconsolate yearning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hard RAIN FALLS. On a high ROOFTOP overlooking the city Lawrence, in human form, lies face down, unconscious. He stirs, awakening. He drags himself to his feet, holdin his head in pain, noticing the WOUNDS on his leg. He touches the wounds, not fully understanding. Lawrence looks down at his tattered, blood-stained SHIRT PANTS. He examines his hands and forearms, which are covered in SCRAPES and LACERATIONS. There's BLOOD under h FINGERNAILS. Now, realization begins to come to him. As Lawrence turns to look out over the storm shrouded CIT the full weight of the lost evening crashes down upon him He falls to his knees, numbed by the horror of it, the RA washing over him. He breaks down ~- afraid, ashamed, enraged -- WEEPING into his hands. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CHURCH'S dark interior is meager in scale and adornme PEWS are empty. An elderly PRIEST lights CANDLES near the entrance. Lawrence enters, still in his wet, torn clothin slowly walking up the CENTER AISLE.

dialogues.speaker: . PRIEST
dialogues.text: May I assist you, son?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'll only be a moment.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST
dialogues.text: Is there something you need? Do you wish confession? Lawrence stops, standing in DARKNESS, without turning.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: It's a little late for that. Lawrence continues. Halfway up the aisle, he takes a seat kneeling. Pale LIGHT filters in through the STAINED GLASS WINDOWS behind a large CROSS over the ALTER. All is QUIET Lawrence puts his hands together, lowers his head.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: (quietly) I'm not here to ask forgiveness. What things I've done... (more)

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: (pause) I don't even remember. I do know I will pay for them. I am damned. I am damned, and there will be a reckoning, soon enough. (pause) I ask one thing, though I have no right. I beg of you... let me do what needs to be done. Give me the strength I'm afraid I don't have. Lawrence looks up, hands still clasped.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Give me the courage to finish this. CuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the PARLOR of this upper middle-class, 3-story ROW HOM Gwen works mending CLOTHING at a SEWING MACHINE. She's weary from lack of sleep. GWEN'S FATHER enters, a man of kindly appearance, wearing a look of great worry.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Gwen, dear.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Yes, Father? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: GWEN'S FATHER
dialogues.text: You'd... better come.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DOWNSTAIRS ENTRYWAY
dialogues.text: Gwen walks down the STAIRS to the front of the house, uncertain, followed by Father. GWEN'S MOTHER, a stout, handsome woman, stands in the HALLWAY, likewise worried. Mother looks to the FRONT DOOR. Gwen follows her gaze... A FIGURE can be seen through the DOOR'S TRANSLUCENT GLASS Gwen crosses quickly, going to OPEN the FRONT DOOR... ON THE PORCH, Lawrence stands, desolate, soaking wet and shivering, holding himself against the cold. Gwen can barely believe her eyes, overcome by emotion. She takes his hands, bringing him inside, SHUTTING the DO cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE in the FIREPLACE. Lawrence sits in a CHAIR, wearing clean, new CLOTHING (borrowed from Gwen's father).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gazes into the flames. Gwen stands at one WINDOW, j watching the RAIN. A large, mantel CLOCK is HEARD TICKING

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Finally... when I awoke, it was with no real memory of last night. Except, of bloodshed. An orgy of violence. (pause) The curse has been passed on from the father to the son. (troubled pause) And, there is one last thing. I'm certain that Benjamin tried to stop my father. (hesitant) I'm just as certain that my father killed Benjamin. Gwen's bathed in the day's cold, pale light.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I'm so very sorry.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: As you say it... I know it's true. I've known I need to begin mourning him. (pause) I just don't know if I can bring myself to accept it. Gwen brushes away tears. Lawrence stands.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: There isn't much time. I've nowhere else to turn.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN -
dialogues.text: What can I do?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: If you can manage it, I need enough money to get a horse.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Why? Where will you go? Lawrence does not answer. Gwen realizes.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No. You can't go back there.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I have to.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: You said yourself, he killed Ben... killed so many others. He'll kill you.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: He has already, Gwen. He has. It will be a full moon again tonight. {looking at his hands) Even now, I feel it... like a crawling beneath my skin; a burning in my veins. I have till before midnight to get to Blackmoor and to end my father's life. And then... (pause) Then, I will do what it takes to end the curse in me. Gwen's shaking her head, agonized.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: There must be some other way... {

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE '
dialogues.text: There isn't.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: There must be! This... this can't be happening!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I can't run, not from this. Not this time. There's no one else. It's my turn to be the one to face responsibility. Lawrence crosses to Gwen, his voice thick with emotion.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Nothing in heaven or on earth can change what's happened, or what happens tonight. Nothing can stop the moon. But, I'd have given anything that our paths might have crossed in some other life. If we'd have only had a chance somehow. Lawrence takes Gwen's hand in his.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I confess... there is a part of me praying that if I'm able to avenge my brother, he may forgive my feelings for you. Feelings I've fought so hard against, please believe me... Lawrence KISSES Gwen's hand. Her heart is breaking.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Forgive me.. Let Benjamin forgive me. Gwen takes Lawrence's face in her hands, presses her lips his. They KISS gently, both crying.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: (quietly) Pray he'll forgive us both.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Goodbye, Gwen.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No. Please, don't go...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Goodbye is all we have left; all life ever had for you and me. (whispers) Goodbye. Tearfully, they share one last KISS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLOOMY SKIES. PEDESTRIANS everywhere. Streets are clogged with VEHICLES. Lawrence, wearing a COAT, makes his way do the crowded SIDEWALK, passing a young STREET HAWKER wavin a NEWSPAPER with a PHOTO of LAWRENCE under the HEADLINE: "ESCAPED MENTAL PATIENT! Brutal Killings in the Night!"

dialogues.speaker: STREET HAWKER
dialogues.text: (droning sales-pitch) Read it here. Escaped Mental Patient. Escaped Mental Patient. Lawrence hides behind his jacket collar, moving on, but t he halts. Ahead, TWO POLICE CONSTABLES stroll this direction. Lawrence quickly turns, hoping he's not been seen, now facing the Street Hawker.

dialogues.speaker: STREET HAWKER
dialogues.text: (still droning) Escaped Mental Patient. Escaped Mental Patient. Street Hawker does a startled double-take: looking at Lawrence, looking to the NEWSPAPER, then back at Lawrence His voice takes on a newfound urgency...

dialogues.speaker: STREET HAWKER
dialogues.text: (POINTING at Lawrence) Escaped mental patient! (more)

dialogues.speaker: STREET HAWKER, (CONT.)
dialogues.text: Escaped mental patient! Escaped mental patient!! Lawrence turns to hurry back the way he came... Comes face-to-face with another POLICE CONSTABLE.

dialogues.speaker: POLICEMAN
dialogues.text: Just one moment, Mister...! The Policeman's brings a WHISTLE to his lips, putting a h on Lawrence. Lawrence grabs the Policeman's arm, TWISTING pulling him forward, then SHOVING him back! The Policeman goes SPRAWLING over Street Hawker's NEWSPAP DISPLAY and STACK of PAPERS, but he's BLOWING his WHISTLE Lawrence wheels to see... The TWO CONSTABLES reacting, RUNNING this way. Lawrence charges straight at them. The lead Constable's raising his BILLY CLUB, but Lawrence lowers his shoulder DIVES into them -- KNOCKING both Constables to the ground Lawrence ROLLS, scrambling to his feet. He RUNS... SHOVING Pedestrians... TOPPLING STREET VENDOR TABLES... He darts into the busy street... Disappearing in the CROWD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAINING HARD. Lawrence RIDES a HORSE at full gallop on a muddy ROADWAY, leaving LONDON behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLOCK'S HEARD TICKING. Gwen sits at the SEWING MACHIN eyes bleary from crying. She just sits there, motionless, staring at the sewing machine for the longest time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAINING. Lawrence RIDES full out through a dark FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen's Mother and Father are seating in the SITTING AREA. She pretends to occupy herself KNITTING. He pretends to b cleaning out his PIPE over a pedestal ASHTRAY. Mother looks over her knitting to watch Father absently p a PIPE CLEANER into the pipe, his mind elsewhere.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN'S MOTHER
dialogues.text: Why don't you see how she's doing? Father looks over, tosses the pipe aside, rising.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE UPSTAIRS HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Gwen's Father comes up-the STAIRS to a closed DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN'S FATHER
dialogues.text: (through door) Gwen?

dialogues.speaker: IN THE PARLOR
dialogues.text: Gwen's Father KNOCKS, looking in...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN'S FATHER
dialogues.text: Gwen, dear, your mother and I... The room's empty. Father's troubled, seeing... The WINDOW'S OPEN to the FIRE ESCAPE outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FOUR HORSE COACH speeds away with LONDON in the B.G., on seemingly the same muddy ROADWAY Lawrence took.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen frets, looking out into the DARKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen's Father is at the open window. As he steps back, he notices a single BULLET beside the SEWING MACHINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen's Father rushes in. He goes to the bed, getting on h hand and knees to reach under. He pulls out a small, meta STRONGBOX, flipping it open. It's empty, except for a few BULLETS.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE GWEN'S COACH
dialogues.text: Gwen takes a PISTOL from her dress pocket, studies it. cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain's stopped. Lawrence halts his weary horse as they reach the crest of a hill, looking across the distance to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TALBOT HOUSE starkly SILHOUETTED against the sky, with th FULL MOON glowing directly above. Lawrence stares for a long, steely-eyed moment. Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence rides his horse quickly on a FOREST TRAIL... | Arriving at the Talbot GRAVEYARD. At the GATE, Lawrence jumps down. He walks in amongst the HEADSTONES. . Mother's ornate TOMB beckons, touched by SHAFTS of MOONLI

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE TOMB
dialogues.text: The heavy DOOR is slowly pushed inwards, inch by inch, ti Lawrence is able to squeeze through, entering. Brushing aside COBWEBS, Lawrence sadly looks upon mother' STONE SARCOPHAGUS, which rests on a PEDESTAL. He steps forward. There's another COFFIN beyond mother's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain, WOODEN COFFIN on the floor. Lawrence is filled with dread, kneeling beside this coffi He removes the LID, reacting to the smell of death. ‘ INSIDE THE COFFIN: a MAN'S ROTTEN CORPSE. Almost three months old, altered by desiccation and decay. Skeletal. Its CLOTHING is CLAWED, SHREDDED, covered in old BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Benjamin. Lawrence swallows, tearful. He's found his brother at las He places a hand on the corpse's chest.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: My brother. I'm sorry. I left you... abandoned you to him. I've regretted it for so long now. Forgive me. Forgive me, that this is our reunion. (agonized) How can it be that I never met the i man you became? How could I have let i that happen? : He stands, looking down at Benjamin's corpse.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Rest in peace. Know that what I do tonight, I do in your name. After a moment, Lawrence bends... CONT INUED oy  98. Taking the REVOLVER from Benjamin's HOLSTER. Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawrence rides at full gallop towards the mansion.

dialogues.speaker: AT TALBOT HOUSE
dialogues.text: IN ONE WINDOW: SIR JOHN'S SILHOUETTE can be seen as he's looking out, till he lets the CURTAIN fail CLOSED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So eee ae Shoving the FRONT DOOR OPEN, Lawrence strides in, throwin off his COAT. He's clutching Ben's REVOLVER, crossing int the Grand Hall with its walis of PAINTINGS, CRESTS, TAPESTRIES, WEAPONS, TROPHIES; Talbot history. ACROSS THE ROOM, Sir John is seated in a CHAIR by the massive FIRE in the FIREPLACE. He holds a BOTTLE of SCOTC The room is lit by CANDLES held in CANDELABRA. j

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Well, well! An unexpected visitor! You are cutting this awfully close, aren't you...? Sir John gestures behind him... Where the large GRANDFATHER CLOCK shows: 11:45.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Fifteen more minutes, and you and I won't be ourselves anymore. Or is that it; have you come to join your father for a night out on the town? Lawrence arrives, gathering his nerve, pointing the gun.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Stand up.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: I'd have Kendall attend to you, but he's fled. Took my goddamn dog with him, the bastard. Have a drink? i Sir John drinks from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Stand up, Sir!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: As you wish. Sir John rises, imposing as ever. CONTINUED i  99. He's well dressed, but more disheveled than usual, unshav There's no sense of drunkenness, but the man, like his manor, is deteriorating.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Calm yourself. You're the one with the weapon, after all. I could have armed myself if I'd wanted... shot you down the moment you walked in.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Call me sentimental. You came all this way... you deserve a sporting chance. Sir John walks as he talks. Lawrence keeps the gun traine

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: You're not entirely unexpected. The asylum sent word of your "escape," though accounts varied wildly, as you might imagine.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: I found Benjamin. I finally found him where you left him. This is his gun. These... his bullets... Lawrence opens the gun, takes out one SILVER BULLET.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Silver. He loaded this weapon with silver bullets... Lawrence puts the bullet back, closes the gun.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Once he realized that there was no other way to stop you. (holding up REVOLVER) i Tell me again you didn't kill him. Deny it, while I hold the proof. Sir John looks away, tortured, guilt eating at him.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: The irony is... we forged those bullets together, long ago. A last resort, we agreed. One I was confident we would never need. (angrily remorseful) He put himself in harm's way. (more) |

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out on the moors, that night. I... I never meant for him to die! How should I have known he'd side with them? How was I to know he'd turn against his own father!?

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Because he was so mucn better a man than you.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: You'll hear no argument from me. Sir John swigs morosely from his bottle.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You killed him with one hand, buried 100. him with the other, and still managed somehow to remove yourself from blame. It was Ben's fault, because he tried to protect the villagers. My fault you attacked me, because I had been warned. Mother died not at your hands, but at the hands of the beast. (furious) All of my life... I thought this family cursed. But, you were the curse on us, Father! All along, it was you.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: You come here to speak for Benjamin... to avenge him...? Sir John's still pacing.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: First, answer how you can even dare call him your brother! Or did you imagine a handful of letters across the years could make up for your betrayal? Because that's what your leaving was... a betrayal! It's Lawrence's turn to face his wounding guilt.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: You know full well how you wronged him... how it was as if a part of himself was torn away when he found you gone. He loved you! (pause) For those wounds you inflicted upon him... I admit could never have forgiven you.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: What of the wounds you inflicted?

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: He may not have been able to bring himself to tell you what he truly thought of you, but Ben and I... we spoke often of your cowardice.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You needn't remind me of my debt to him. I'm here to repay some part of it tonight. Lawrence looks across to... The GRANDFATHER CLOCK. It's 11:49.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: As for cowardice... it means so little coming from a man who, having torn out the throat of his beloved wife, hadn't the courage to end his own life.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Again, think what you will of me and the suffering that's been my lot. I don't expect you to believe me, but I would've gladiy traded places with your mother if I could have...

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Easy to say.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: As it was, my death would have done nothing more than to orphan my sons.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: And all the better for it we would have been! Or have you forgotten...? You murdered us! One by one, you murdered us all! Look around! They're standing at the center of the Grand Hall.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: This is what remains of the family you speak of with such reverence. Your trophies... the sound of your own voice... the ghosts of your victims. That's all you have left! Everything else you destroyed. (bitterly) All for Carmilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you speak her name.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: Her own love was proven, beyond a doubt. She suffered endless humiliations, though she could have had her freedom merely by confessing your name. But, she kept silent... to protect you. Out of love. Lawrence keeps the gun trained on Sir John.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You, meanwhile, kept a different silence. Having weighed your feelings for her against your instinct for self-preservation. You wouldn't dare risk your social standing or the precious honor of the Talbot name! So, you abandoned her to her husband's tender mercies. And she took her life... alone. Heartbroken. Sir John drinks, sunk in grief.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: You were the end of her... not Strickland... not the citizens of Blackmoor! You were her reason for living and her reason for dying! Sir John wheels, THROWING his bottle... It SHATTERS against the wall!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: No more! I'll hear no more!

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: For you to commit murder in her name and call it vengeance is a sick perversion of her memory.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: (enraged) Then be done with me! Enough talk! End it now! That is a gun in your hand, is it not?! Oh, but first... first let me inform you of one small detail. You see, before you came in... I took the liberty of turning the clock back ten minutes. ZOOM IN: on the GRANDFATHER CLOCK which now reads, 11:50.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: (angry mocking) So...the time you thought you had in which to screw up your courage is gone! This, son, is your moment of truth! Lawrence is unnerved, uncertain. He looks up as... The BLACKMOOR CLOCKTOWER is HEARD TOLLING from the distan Sir John steps up, defiant, pounds his chest.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Here is your chance to finally show your father what you are made of!! If you think you have it in you to pull the trigger, DO IT! Do it. Lawrence grits his teeth, angry, terrified... He's leveling the revolver squarely at Sir John's chest, the gun TREMBLES in his hand. With the far off CLOCKTOWER TOLLING, all Lawrence's years of fear of and pent-up hatr for his father culminate in this decisive instant.

dialogues.speaker: LAWRENCE
dialogues.text: When I first arrived... you asked what difference my returning to Talbot Hall could make. (pause) Here is your answer! Lawrence PULLS the TRIGGER... The HAMMER FALLS, but NOTHING HAPPENS! Lawrence and Sir John are stunned. Lawrence pulls the trigger again! Nothing! Sir John's disbelief turns to rage as he KNOCKS the gun away -- PUNCHING! Lawrence is thrown to the floor!

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Good God, you did it! Lawrence tries to rise, but Sir John KICKS him down! Sir John's manic, seems almost proud.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: The grave's damp must've gotten to the powder, but still... a valiant effort! I honestly didn't think you had it in you! Lawrence is on his feet, letting out a CRY as... He TACKLES Sir John! They go CRASHING through the sitting area, scattering the CHAIRS and SIDE TABLES. They fight in front of the roaring FIRE, trading blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir John's fists STRIKE like sledgehammers! Lawrence manages to block one of his father's swings, countering with a PUNCH that sends Sir John to the floor. Sir John wipes his bloodied mouth as he's rising.

dialogues.speaker: SIR JOHN
dialogues.text: Nicely done! Lawrence is immediately on Sir John, pinning him, getting both hands around Sir John's neck Lawrence puts everything he's got into tightening his STRANGLE HOLD on his father's windpipe! Sir John struggle And just when it seems like Lawrence has the upper hand.. Just as Sir John's having the life choked out of him... Sir John STARTS TRANSFORMING! His TEETH LENGTHEN and beco florrid FANGS! His reddening face GROWS its grey-tinged F while his HANDS SPROUT dense FUR and lethal CLAWS! Much to Lawrence's dismay, he's now fighting the brutally powerful GREY-WEREWOLF in MID-TRANSFORMATION! Grey—Werewo breaks Lawrence's grip, brings one leg up and KICKS -- se Lawrence FLIPPING backwards in the air... Lawrence THUDS to the floor across the room. Grey-Werewolf rises, the "change" complete. He looks around, furious and disoriented, as one might imagine. He announces himself with+a window rattling ROAR! — Lawrence covers his ears as he's getting to his feet. Grey-Werewolf turns, heading for Lawrence, nostrils flari saliva dripping from his wicked maw. Lawrence goes to a dusty SUIT of ARMOR, taking the long, deadly SPEAR the posed KNIGHT was holding. As Grey-Werewolf advances, thirsting for carnage, Lawrenc wields the spear. Grey-Werewolf doesn't seem to care or understand the spear, till Lawrence... SLICES into Grey-Werewolf's arm! Grey-Werewolf backs off bloodied. Confused. Lawrence keeps SWINGING the spear, keeping Grey-Werewolf at bay. Lawrence maneuvers over to grab an unlit OIL LAMP from a WRITING DESK against the wall, THROWS the LAMP... The oil lamp SHATTERS against Grey-Werewolf, SOAKING the of his arm, torso and beastly face with OIL. Undeterred, Grey-Werewolf advances... Lawrence is backed up against the desk, trapped.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He raises the spear -- STABBING... The spear PIERCES Grey-Werewolf below his left collar bon the SPEARHEAD bursting bloodily out Grey-Werewolf's back! Grey-Werewolf SCREAMS, staggered, clutching the spear. Lawrence runs over to the mounted GUN RACK where many of John's PISTOLS and RIFLES are displayed. He grabs a large SHOTGUN.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Grey-Werewolf grasps at the spear, but the spear's flared arrowhead-like point is impossible to pull out backwards.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GUN RACK
dialogues.text: Lawrence clutches the SHOTGUN as he kneels before the low long, wooden GUN CABINET. He throws the CABINET DOORS ope pulling out a heavy WOODEN BOX. Lawrence opens the box. It's filled with ALL KINDS of AMMUNITION. He grabs a BOX of SHOTGUN SHELLS, however... The VEINS on the back of Lawrence's hands THROB! FUR is starting to GROW! It's happening. Transformation's begun

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Lawrence looks over his shoulder to where... Grey-Werewolf still struggles to remove the spear. Lawrence looks over his other shoulder to... The FIRE in the fireplace.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Grey-Werewolf falls to his knees, falling on the spear's shaft, which drives it further into his body!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE GUN RACK
dialogues.text: Lawrence sucks air, struggling against the irresistible forces overtaking his physiology. He slams the AMMUNITION BOX SHUT, lifting it as he stands, fighting a wave of pai FUR is APPEARING across Lawrence's face as he runs.. He stumbles to the fireplace, lifting the closed ammuniti box and HEAVING it INTO THE FIRE! Mission accomplished. Lawrence's body contorts involuntarily, taking him to his knees. His TRANSFORMATION'S PROCEEDING in earnest. His body QUAKES as his lupine alter-ego's winning out!  106.

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Grey-Werewolf's pulling the spear towards him -- hand ove hand -- FEEDING its entire length through his body till t bloody spear finally CLATTERS to the floor behind him. Grey-Werewolf turns his attention back to Lawrence... Except, Lawrence is now THE WOLFMAN, ROARING!

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CENTER OF THE ROOM
dialogues.text: Grey-Werewolf and the Wolfman circle each other... They're sizing one another up... They both rush forward, GRAPPLING... It's a vicious, werewolf vs. werewolf battle royal! They CLAW at each other, SLASHING, teeth GNASHING! Grey-Werewolf and the Wolfman THROW each other around the room ~- SMASHING into walls -- TOPPLING BOOKSHELVES and bringing PAINTINGS and WEAPONRY CRASHING DOWN! cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACKMOOR can be seen in the distance as Gwen's coach spe along, heading left at the ROAD'S FORK. cur To: INT. TALBOT HOUSE, GRAND HALL -- NIGHT ‘ The battle rages on as Grey-Werewolf lifts up the GRANDFATHER CLOCK and HEAVES IT! The Wolfman LEAPS high, avoiding the SPLINTERING CLOCK... He grabs onto the huge, wooden CHANDELIER above, SWINGING the straining ROPE holding the chandelier CREAKS. Grey-Werewolf runs, JUMPS... CLIMBING straight up a vast TAPESTRY. He JUMPS again... DIGGING his CLAWS into the ROOF BEAMS, climbing towards t center of the room, above the chandelier. IN THE FIREPLACE: the ammo box shifts, engulfed in FLAMES Above, the Wolfman SWINGS himself up... LANDS standing astride the still wildly CAREENING chandelier. He ROARS to the ceiling as... Grey-Werewolf DROPS, attacking... COLLIDING with the Wolfman, pulling them both down! BELOW, Grey-Werewolf and the Wolfman TUMBLE down the central STAIRCASE, fighting all the way... They hit the floor, sent SPRAWLING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As The Wolfman rises, Grey-Werewolf LEAPS onto him from j behind, grabbing on and, SINKING HIS TEETH into Wolfman's shoulder! Wolfman HOWLS! : { Grey-Werewolf hangs on relentlessly, BITING DEEPLY, while Wolfman's CLAWING back at him, trying frenziedly to throw him off, and it's just then that... IN THE FIREPLACE: the burning ammo box EXPLODES! The massive EXPLOSION throws a huge FIREBALL -- SHOOTING whistling BULLETS and PELLETS in every direction at once! The BLAST sends the Wolfman and Grey-Werewolf FLYING in a shock-wave of burning DEBRIS and sizzling BULLETS! WINDOWS are SHATTERING! The Wolfman SLAMS into one wall, landing in a heap, his b bearing many SMOLDERING BULLET WOUNDS. Grey-Werewolf's fallen by the STAIRS, rising up and SCREAMING as half his body is BURNING! The LAMP OIL that soaked his fur is now ablaze! Grey-Werewolf writhes, spastically trying to shake off th flames, which only makes it worse. He FLEES headlong into the HALLWAY under the STAIRCASE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: — EE SER GARDENS 7 MOMENTS LATER ~~ NIGHT The half-BURNING FIGURE of Grey-Werewolf comes SMASHING o through the WINDOWS of the CONSERVATORY! Grey-Werewolf goes ROLLING down through the hillside GARDENS, still BURNING as he's TUMBLING out of control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolfman rises slowly. FIERY EMBERS rain down. Everywhere, CURTAINS, RUGS and TAPESTRIES are ABLAZE. The explosion has doomed Talbot Hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolfman leaps out the jagged HOLE in the conservatory WINDOWS. He lands in the GARDENS, searching warily. He heads for the FOREST. cur TO: INT. GWEN'S COACH -- IN MOTION -- NIGHT i Gwen looks out the COACH WINDOW, horrified upon seeing... In the distance: TALBOT HALL BURNS. cur To: i  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wolfman enters the clearing presided over by the loom CASTLE RUINS. He searches, SNIFFING the air, watchful. As he nears the ruins, a huge STONE comes SMASHING DOWN - barely missing him -- imbedding into the ground! The Wolfman looks up to where... Grey-Werewolf stands atop a high, CORNER TOWER, HURLING another huge STONE down! The Wolfman dodges the deadly projectile, runs and LEAPS. He starts quickly SCALING the tower. Above, Grey-Werewolf's terribly wounded; upper TORSO, ARM and half his FACE sickeningly BURNED; the FUR BURNED OFF. He YELLS down, KICKING loose a section of the BATTLEMENT. The Wolfman scrambles aside to avoid the falling STONES. Cur To:

dialogues.text: As the coach arrives, Gwen leaps out. She and the Driver look on in awe as SMOKE and FLAMES pou from the MANSION'S broken WINDOWS and open FRONT DOOR. Gwen runs to the STAIRS, past where Lawrence's HORSE is t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen enters, surrounded by FLAMES. She covers her mouth a nose, taking in the heat-warped scene of destruction. FIRE SPREADS irrevocably, consuming everything.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: (calling out) Lawrence! Lawrence! CLOSE-ON: the beautiful PORTRAIT of LAWRENCE'S MOTHER as it's BURNING. FLAMES hungrily devour ancient paint. MOTHER'S FACE blisters... her image disappearing into ash Gwen looks straight up, retreating as. Above, the ROPE holding the chandelier BURNS, FRAYING. Gwen flees into the ENTRY PARLOR, not looking back as the CHANDELIER CRASHES THUNDEROUSLY down behind her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gwen runs down the front stairs, calling...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Where are you, Lawrence?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A far off HOWLING is HEARD. Gwen turns, listening intentl Another ROARING CRY comes from the distance. Gwen runs to Lawrence's horse, untying it and climbing up She RIDES off to follow the werewolf's ululation. cur To: .

dialogues.speaker: EELS,
dialogues.text: Just as the Wolfman climbs atop the corner tower, Grey-Werewolf makes a spectacular LEAP... Grabbing onto the curved, outer wall of the larger, neighboring TOWER; the CASTLE KEEP. Grey-Werewolf climbs. Behind, the Wolfman JUMPS after... Actually leaping INTO one of the gaping HOLES in the side the keep; climbing the exposed SPIRAL STAIRCASE INSIDE...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TOP OF THE KEEP
dialogues.text: The Wolfman and Grey-Werewolf arrive simultaneously in th remains of this large, circular, ROOFLESS ROOM at the highest point of the ruins. They square off, both letting loose nightmarish CRIES of RAGE! But, neither is going ba down, of course, and so the pitched BATTLE is REJOINED... They start RIPPING INTO EACH OTHER... SLASHING and COUNTER-SLASHING, unrelentingly... Sending BLOOD SPRAYING up into the night air Grey-Werewolf SWINGS, but the Wolfman catches the blow an BITES a CHUNK out of Grey-Werewolf's forearm! Grey-Werewolf SPINS, BASHING the Wolfman back... Wolfman SLAMS against a WALL which immediately FALLS AWAY exposing the PRECIPITOUS DROP beyond. Then, the whole TOWER'S SHAKING... BELOW: FISSURES begin spider-webbing across the tower's already FRACTURED surface. The Wolfman and Grey-Werewolf continue their animalistic Danse Macabre, trading LACERATING STRIKES, the both of th covered in countless crimson SLASHES and GOUGES. Suddenly, a RUMBLE is HEARD, growing DEAFENING as... The FLOOR literally FALLS OUT from under the Wolfman and Grey-Werewolf! The entire TOWER is CRUMBLING DOWN! We lose sight of the Wolfman and Grey-Werewolf in the AVALANCHE of falling STONES and rising DUST!

dialogues.text: FOLLOW: Gwen riding quickly, holding her PISTOL, arriving  be i °

dialogues.speaker: AT THE RUINS
dialogues.text: Gwen rides into the clearing, looking to the DUST CLOUD hanging over the castle. As she urges her horse forward.. Grey-Werewolf rises into view, climbing RUBBLE to the sta atop a low section of broken RAMPART WALL; he's carrying unconscious Wolfman over his head in both hands! Gwen is aghast. Grey-Werewolf HOWLS to the sky, throwing Wolfman's motionless body to the forest floor below. Grey-Werewolf leaps down... Moving to where the Wolfman lies unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No! Gwen struggles to control her rearing horse, taking aim - FIRING her pistol repeatedly! BULLETS STRIKE around Grey-Werewolf! He's HIT in the ARM, BLOOD SPLATTERING! He turns to face Gwen, SNARLING! Gwen keeps firing, but her GUN'S gone EMPTY. She yanks on her reins, RIDING AWAY... Grey-Werewolf angrily gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER UP THE FOREST TRAIL
dialogues.text: Gwen rides full out, glancing back... From the DARKNESS, Grey-Werewolf is closing the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Gwen races into the WATERFALL CLEARING... Grey-Werewolf JUMPS onto her horse's REAR HAUNCHES... DRAGGING the SCREECHING horse down! Gwen is THROWN to the dirt... Grey-Werewolf's THROWN, ROLLING. The wounded horse clamors to it's feet, fleeing. Gwen recovers, running towards the CLIFF and roaring WATERFALL ahead. Grey-Werewolf pursues. Grey-Werewolf LEAPS forward... Taking Gwen to the ground! Gwen SCREAMS, trying crawl away, but the gory Grey-Werewo is astride her, holding her. He's bent over her, TOUCHING her DRESS, almost gently, as if toying with her... His claws TEARING the fabric.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No, Lawrence... it's me. It's Gwen! The Wolfman circles, never taking his burning eyes off he Gwen turns so she's always facing him, pleading.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Lawrence, please. Don't do this! Look at me! You... you know who I am! You know me! The Wolfman SNARLS, regarding her as easy prey.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN \

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If goodbye is truly all we have... this is mine. Know, that I had feelings for you, Lawrence. Remember that I loved you... I loved you too! CLOSE-ON: GWEN REFLECTED in the Wolfman's narrowing eyes. just as there seems to come some glimmer of recognition. For a moment, the Wolfman's ghastly features soften as he regards Gwen... like perhaps the man trapped inside the beast has somehow resurfaced...? The Wolfman edges closer, not threateningly, but with a k of curicsity. Gwen recognizes the moment.

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: Lawrence? Suddenly, the Wolfman rears back, HOWLING, arms extended, claws clutching -- a lamenting, tortured HOWL. Gwen recoils, covering her ears, stumbling back... She falls to the ground. The Wolfman charges at Gwen... Gwen SCREAMS as he is upon her! The Wolfman LEAPS over Gwen, running across the clearing, moving straight for the CLIFF'S EDGE. Gwen turns to look... realizing...

dialogues.speaker: GWEN
dialogues.text: No! At the CLIFF overlooking the WATERFALL, the Wolfman LEAPS out into MID-AIR... FALLING into the chasm... PLUMMETING a great distance...

dialogues.speaker: BELOW
dialogues.text: The Wolfman SMASHES into the jagged CLIFFSIDE... FLIPPING again and again as he... FALLS... ever downward... His body being BASHED and brutalized, LIMBS RAVAGED... BONES BREAKING, consciousness gone, till at last.. The Wolfman SPLASHES into the RIVER BASIN at the base of WATERFALL! He's immediately gone from sight below the CHURNING WATER. He does not resurface.  113.

dialogues.text: Gwen staggers to the cliff's edge, looking down, her hand over her mouth. She lets out an echoing CRY! She kneels, hanging her head, bereft, SOBBING. The FULL MOON shines down through the treetops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BIRDS SING. On the dawn-kissed banks of the RIVER, down- stream from the roaring WATERFALL feeding it, we find... LAWRENCE'S CORPSE, battered and broken. Human again. Lying there, with his eyes closed, half-in the river whil the shore's gently undulating water caresses his hair and placid face, Lawrence looks almost at peace.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE ENCAMPMENT
dialogues.text: At the CLIFF'S EDGE, the ancient, fortune-teller, Old Maleva, peers out across the endless OCEAN. She turns, heading back through the camp.

dialogues.text: Old Maleva enters. A BABY can be HEARD CRYING. THREE youn GYPSY NURSE-MAIDS are crowded around a veiled, INFANT'S CRIB. As they see Olid Maleva approaching, they step away Old Maleva comes to part the crib's VEILS, reaching in to gently pick up the crying BABY, a dark-haired BOY, mere months old, wrapped in BLANKETS. His EYES are GREEN. Sullen, sallow-faced Bela enters. Old Maleva goes to sit, cradling the child lovingly. Bela walks to stand at Old Maleva's side. Old Maleva begi reciting a SING-SONG an INCANTATION in a whispered, incomprehensible tongue, gently rocking the now quieting child back and forth in her arms.
